Greg Casar: a member of the Austin City Council, stated that Austin has been ranked repeatedly as one of the most economically segregated cities in the country.
A February 2015 study conducted by the M: Round Rock-San Marcos area as the most economically segregated large metro area in the United States.
The study evaluated various measures of: educational, and occupational segregation, as well as an overall economic segregation index.
Richard Florida: the author of "The New Urban Crisis," also highlighted Austin as a city divided by economic inequality, with a concentration of the creative class in certain areas and substantial revitalization in downtown.
